markings:
Marks

Fully marked on outside rim of body.  Maker\'s mark and lion passant on underside of handle.
text: Hester Bateman, the widow of silversmith John Bateman, registered her mark at the Goldsmith's Hall in London in 1761.  It was standard practice for a widow to continue to run her husband's business after his death.  Bateman is one of the best known and most prolific woman silversmiths of the 18th century and this oval basket with pieced decoration is very typical of her workshop.
title: Cake basket
